text: <@U01QVR44MEY> if it's for workflows and you post here I'll probably notice it. In general posting in <#C2YHAHB6K|api> is probably the best place, and somebody from HubSpot should see it and be able to forward on to our docs team

<@U032A8A6P1T> one thing I'd verify is that you're completing the callback in the correct portalâ€”you'll want to make sure you're authed for the portal that the workflow is executing in, not the developer portal that the action was created in

i am doing xero api 2 factor authentication from HubSpot workflow custom code.. and i want to hit the user autherization redirect url that can be open a new xero login window and after login, i select the organization and he gave me the access token and refresh token.but i am not able to open the new login window from autherization redirect url in workflow custom code.

I figured it out. What I learned is what you said about being authed from the right portal and the right app. Doing a callback in postman using a private app key doesn't work. You need to use an access token from oAuth of the app and then make the callback. This must be how the appId aspect of it is validated. Also, we had some issues in our code and when I did a more direct post using Axios, it worked.
Nice work Scott!

Hi all, I'm new to building custom-coded workflow actions. Can anyone help me with the syntax for assigning association labels to newly created Contact-to-Deal associations? Details in this forum post: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/9881-Operations-Hub/Add-an-association-label-when-associating-Contact-to-Deal-with/td-p/719461>

On this line:
```HubSpotClient.crm.deals.associationsApi.create(searchDealResponse.body.results[0].id,'contacts', event.object.objectId,'deal_to_contact');```
Swap deal_to_contact with the association type id of your choice
Is that it? Thanks so much!
Of course
<@U01QVR44MEY> Unfortunately that did not work. Do I need to include the associationCategory too?
Did you define the association label?
or is it a HubSpot label?
I defined them
I do not see the label ID's in the back end of the dashboard
Ok, so what id did you use?
I used "99" as that appears to be the ID number from the URL.
and what happens when you use "policyholder" in place of deal_to_contact
let me try!
And when you said that didn't work did it return an error?
WHOA, "policyholder" worked!
Thanks so much! :partyparrot:
Of course, let me know if you run into any issues in the future. Also may update the community post with the solution
This message was deleted.
What does the error message say?
I think it's your association label, did you define that yourself
If it's the association label check this out <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C019VT42R8X/p1668711321387819>
Fixed
Awesome, why did you delete the question?
Thought it would remove the thread! Whoops
It helps for other people that have the same issue, you can search and find solutions really easily
Not an issue if you want it removed, delete it I thought I might have been a mistake
Yes, will avoid this moving forward! Happy to re-open the message but not giving me the option :cry:
Not a problem
On another note: copying the Python functions from HubSpot API docs into custom code works pretty flawlessly!
Yes it does super nice feature
